trans-unit.source: This class is the main entry point that the designer uses to interact with the model.
The service has a split between public and protected methods that you must implement when you create a derived class.
The public methods are callable by anyone.
The protected methods are invoked by the model.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Services.ModelService"></xref>.
Takes an existing instance and creates a model item that is a deep clone of the instance.
The item to clone and wrap.
Returns a newly created <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> that is a clone of the existing item.
Creates a <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> for a given type.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelFactory"></xref> when the user wants to create a new item.
The type of item to create.
Creation options.
You can specify whether you would like to initialize default values for an item.
An array of arguments to the constructor of the item.
Returns the newly created <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref>.
Creates a new model item that represents the value of a static member of the given class.
For example, to add a reference to `Brushes.Red` to the model, call this method with `typeof(Brushes)` and the string "Red" as the parameters.
This will be serialized into XAML as `{x:Static Brushes.Red}`.
The type that contains the static member being referenced.
The name of the static member being referenced.
Returns <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref>.
Finds matching model items given a starting point from which to look.
All walks are recursive.
The <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> from which to start the search.
Items above this item will be ignored.
This item, and any item below it in the hierarchy, will be included in the search.
If this value is `null`, <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Services.ModelService.Root"></xref> is used instead.
A predicate that allows more complex type matching to be used.
This method will enumerate all items within the given parent scope that match the predicate.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> that contains all model items that match the query.
match is `null`.
Finds matching model items given a starting point from which to look.
All walks are recursive.
The <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> from which to start the search.
Items above this item will be ignored.
This item, and any item below it in the hierarchy, will be included in the search.
If this value is `null`, <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Services.ModelService.Root"></xref> is used instead.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the object to find.
This method will enumerate all items within the given parent scope that are of the requested type.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> that contains all model items that match the query.
type is `null`.
Locates the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> in the given scope with the given name.
An optional scope to provide.
If the scope is not provided, <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Services.ModelService.Root"></xref> will be used as a scope.
If the scope is provided, the nearest <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.INameScope"></xref> in the hierarchy will be used to locate the item.
The name to locate.
Returns a whose name matches name, or `null` if no match was found.
name is `null`.
Locates the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> in the given scope with the given name.
An optional scope to provide.
If the scope is not provided, <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Services.ModelService.Root"></xref> will be used as a scope.
If the scope is provided, the nearest <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.INameScope"></xref> in the hierarchy will be used to locate the item.
The name to locate.
Determines how the name should be compared.
The default is to compare against ordinal.
Returns a whose name matches name, or `null` if no match was found.
name is `null`.
This event is raised when something in the model has changed.
The event arguments in the event can be used to find what has changed.
The root of the object hierarchy.
For linear stores, the root is the first object in the store.
For stores that represent a tree of objects, this returns the topmost node of the tree.
Returns the root of the model hierarchy as a <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref>.
